column1: Barretos is a municipality in the northern part of the state of São Paulo
column3: 344 inhabitants (IBGE/2018) and an area of 1566.1 km². Barretos belongs to the Mesoregion of Ribeirão Preto.

column1: The city was founded on August 25
column2: 1854. The first chapel was built in 1856
column3: where today lies the "Praça Francisco Barreto". On January 8
column5: Barretos was officially established as a municipality.

column1: The tertiary sector of the city is the most relevant
column2: with 72.09% of the city GDP. Industry is 21.64% of the GDP
column3: and the primary sector corresponds to 6.28%. The largest Latin American cancer center is based in this city.

column1: Barretos hosts annually the most famous rodeo festival in the country
column2: the Festa do Peão de Barretos. The city is the seat of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Barretos.

column1: SP-425 Rodovia Assis ChateaubriandBarretos is served by Chafei Amsei Airport
column2: which offers general aviation but no scheduled flights.

column1: Barretos EC - a football club that is in the Campeonato Paulista Segunda Divisão.
